Out of the four films you mentioned, I'd highly recommend "The Constant Gardener". It's a thrilling drama starring Kirsten Dunst alongside Ralph Fiennes and Rachel Weisz. The story follows a widower's journey across continents to uncover the truth about his wife's death, which leads to some explosive revelations. It's an engaging and thought-provoking watch!

Another movie featuring Kirsten Dunst is "The X Files" in 1998. This science fiction series revolves around FBI agents Mulder and Scully as they investigate unexplained, often paranormal, cases, including a conspiracy about an alien colonization of Earth. It's a captivating mix of mystery, suspense, and the unknown. Enjoy!

Given your interest in urban legends and the actor Kirsten Dunst, I'd recommend checking out "Wag the Dog". It's a satirical comedy where Hollywood and politics collide when a spin doctor and a movie producer join forces to fabricate a war to cover up a Presidential scandal. Kirsten Dunst stars in this interesting and engaging film alongside Robert De Niro.

Also, "Lady in the Water" by M. Night Shyamalan might appeal to you as well. In this fantasy drama, a building superintendent discovers a woman from a bedtime story living in his apartment complex and helps protect her from dangerous creatures. The movie features an interesting cast including Paul Giamatti, Bryce Dallas Howard, and Bob Balaban. Enjoy the magical journey!
